trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> objects.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods enable you to add and remove individual controls from the collection.

You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> methods to add or remove all the controls from the collection.
You can determine if a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> is a member of the collection by passing the control into the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Contains%2A> method.
To get the index value of the location of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> in the collection, pass the control into the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.
The collection can be copied into an array by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection.CopyTo%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> representing the control that owns the control collection.
Adds the specified control to the control collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to add <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the end of the control collection.
You can also add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the collection by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> method.

To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> that you previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Remove%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.RemoveAt%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> methods.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> can only be assigned to one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> at a time.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> is already a child of another control it is removed from that control before it is added to another control.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> to add to the control collection.
The specified control is a top-level control, or a circular control reference would result if this control were added to the control collection.
The object assigned to the value parameter is not a .
Adds an array of control objects to the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects contained in the `controls` array are appended to the end of the collection.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> method to quickly add a group of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the collection instead of manually adding each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> to the collection using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A> method.

To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> that you previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Remove%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.RemoveAt%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> methods.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> objects to add to the collection.
Removes all controls from the collection.
You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> method to remove the entire collection of controls from a parent control.

To remove an individual control from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Remove%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods.
Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> method does not remove control handles from memory.
You must explicitly call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Dispose%2A> method to avoid memory leaks.

To add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> methods.
Determines whether the specified control is a member of the collection.
This method enables you to determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> is a member of the collection before attempting to perform operations on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control>.
You can use this method to confirm that a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> has been added to or is still a member of the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> to locate in the collection.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> is a member of the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref> contains an item with the specified key.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.
The key to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref> contains an item with the specified key; otherwise, `false`.
Searches for controls by their <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Name"></xref> property and builds an array of all the controls that match.
The key to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref>.
`true` to search all child controls; otherwise, `false`.
An array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> containing the matching controls.
The key parameter is `null` or the empty string ("").
Retrieves the index of the specified child control within the control collection.
The control with an index value of zero is at the top of the z-order, and higher numbers are closer to the bottom.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> to search for in the control collection.
A zero-based index value that represents the location of the specified child control within the control collection.
The child is not in the .
Retrieves the index of the specified child control within the control collection, and optionally raises an exception if the specified control is not within the control collection.
The control with an index value of zero is at the top of the z-order, and higher numbers are closer to the bottom.
A return value of -1 is returned only when the `throwException` parameter is `false`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> to search for in the control collection.
`true` to throw an exception if the specified in the child parameter is not a control in the ; otherwise, `false`.

A zero-based index value that represents the location of the specified child control within the control collection; otherwise -1 if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> is not found in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref>.
The child is not in the , and the throwException parameter value is `true`.
Retrieves a reference to an enumerator object that is used to iterate over a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref>.
Retrieves the index of the specified control in the control collection.
If the control is not found in the collection, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.IndexOf%2A> method return value is -1.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> to locate in the collection.
A zero-based index value that represents the position of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref>.
Retrieves the index of the first occurrence of the specified item within the collection.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, or an item with the specified key is not found, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.
The name of the control to search for.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of the control with the specified name in the collection.
Indicates the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> at the specified indexed location in the collection.
To retrieve a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>, reference the collection object with a specific index value.
The index value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> is a zero-based index.
The index of the control to retrieve from the control collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> located at the specified index location within the control collection.
The index value is less than zero or is greater than or equal to the number of controls in the collection.
Indicates a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> with the specified key in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.
The name of the control to retrieve from the control collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> with the specified key within the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref>.
Gets the control that owns this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> that owns this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref>.
Removes the specified control from the control collection.
When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> is removed from the control collection, all subsequent controls are moved up one position in the collection.

You can also remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method, or remove all controls by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> method.

To add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> methods.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection"></xref>.
Removes a control from the control collection at the specified indexed location.
When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> is removed from the control collection, all subsequent controls are moved up one position in the collection.

You can also remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> that you previously added by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Remove%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> methods.

To add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> methods.
The index value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> to remove.
Removes the child control with the specified key.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.
The name of the child control to remove.
Sets the index of the specified child control in the collection to the specified index value.

When <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.SetChildIndex%2A> is called, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> referred to by the `child` parameter is moved to the position specified by `newIndex` and the other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> references in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> are reordered to accommodate the move.
The control with an index value of zero is at the top of the z-order, and higher numbers are closer to the bottom.
The child to search for.
The new index value of the control.
The child control is not in the .
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Remove(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ICloneable.Clone"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ICloneable> interface.
